alert.note: Alert for Northern Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 08 at 12:51AM PST until March 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 1500 feet, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 3000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible, with higher amounts across taller peaks. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Northern Trinity County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday morning through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
